div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: Middle School Teacher Publishes Children’s Self-Help Book

a.span: Middle School Teacher Publishes Children’s Self-Help Book

div.p: The passing of a loved one can be a difficult concept for a child to grasp, let alone talk about, which is why Seaford Middle School sixth grade teacher Danielle Alveari wrote a book about it. “Little Lucy May’s Loss,” a children’s self-help book on grief, was recently released by Amazon and Ms. Alveari dream of becoming a published author was realized.

a.title: Go to comments for Middle School Teacher Publishes Children’s Self-Help Book

img.alt: ‘Piranhas Don’t Eat Bananas’ Wins Manor Book Tournament

a.span: ‘Piranhas Don’t Eat Bananas’ Wins Manor Book Tournament

div.p: The second annual March Madness book tournament at Seaford Manor Elementary School generated lots of excitement for students who participated in four rounds of voting before a winning book was named.

a.title: Go to comments for ‘Piranhas Don’t Eat Bananas’ Wins Manor Book Tournament

img.alt: VIDEO: A Message From the Seaford Music Department

a.span: VIDEO: A Message From the Seaford Music Department

a.title: Go to comments for VIDEO: A Message From the Seaford Music Department

img.alt: Music Program in the National Spotlight

a.span: Music Program in the National Spotlight

div.p: A strong school-community connection helped garner national recognition for Seaford School District’s music program, earning a spot on the 2020 list of Best Communities for Music Education. It was the first time the district has earned this distinction from the National Association of Music Merchants Foundation.

a.title: Go to comments for Music Program in the National Spotlight

img.alt: Four Seaford Juniors Selected to Boys State Program

a.span: Four Seaford Juniors Selected to Boys State Program

div.p: Four Seaford High School students have been selected to participate in American Legion Boys State, a leadership action program. Craig Ackerman, Colin Merrigan, Michael Scimeca and Brian Wise will be sponsored by Seaford American Legion Post No. 1132.

a.title: Go to comments for Four Seaford Juniors Selected to Boys State Program

img.alt: Seaford Middle School Combats Vaping Epidemic

a.span: Seaford Middle School Combats Vaping Epidemic

div.p: The rise in the number of teens vaping has caught the eye of school officials across the country, including Seaford. At Seaford Middle School, Principal Dan Smith and Assistant Principal Lisa Dunn say they are hoping to reverse the trend through education efforts.

a.title: Go to comments for Seaford Middle School Combats Vaping Epidemic

img.alt: Harbor Hosts a Night of Numbers

a.span: Harbor Hosts a Night of Numbers

div.p: Seaford Harbor Elementary School’s second annual Math Night on Feb. 6 drew a large crowd of both students and parents who discovered together that numbers can be lots of fun. They traveled from station to station to practice a variety of mathematical concepts.

a.title: Go to comments for Harbor Hosts a Night of Numbers

img.alt: Seaford Drama Club to Present ‘All Shook Up’

a.span: Seaford Drama Club to Present ‘All Shook Up’

div.p: A Shakespeare tale with a rock ’n’ roll twist is coming to the Seaford High School stage in early March as the Drama Club will perform “All Shook Up.” The show will feature numerous Elvis songs including “Blue Suede Shoes,” “Jailhouse Rock,” “Heartbreak Hotel,” “Can’t Help Falling in Love” and more.

a.title: Go to comments for Seaford Drama Club to Present ‘All Shook Up’

div.p: This year’s Pick a Reading Partner program at Seaford Manor Elementary School had a fitting end as students shared books with their partners. The three-week initiative came to a close just before the February break with buddy reading on Feb. 13 and 14.

a.title: Go to comments for Books Build Bonds at Manor

img.alt: A Happy Hundredth Day at Harbor

a.span: A Happy Hundredth Day at Harbor

div.p: The 100th day of school at Seaford Harbor Elementary School was filled with counting activities as kindergartners celebrated a milestone moment in their educations on Feb. 13. Many wore special hats declaring themselves “100 Days Smarter.”

a.title: Go to comments for A Happy Hundredth Day at Harbor
